The boss of a Woolworths supermarket has been slammed as "disgraceful" after the Fair Work Commission found he fired a 66-year-old female worker via text message because he preferred to employ staff from an Asian background.

The council said Gail Ayton owner Jianbin Wang, who has worked at the Wagga Wagga store for more than 20 years, had treated staff in a "grossly unfair" manner and may have breached anti-discrimination laws.
Ms Ayton told the committee that Mr Wang, who took over the shop in 2016, had been "trying to fire me" because she was not Chinese.
In this case, Peter Sams, the commission's vice-president, conducted an internet search and found "some of Mr Wang's past job advertisements posted at various Chinese-Australian employment forums."
The posts listed job requirements, with one saying "preferred Asian lady" and the other saying "preferred Asian employee."
A third post said he was "more inclined to go overseas [sic]."
Mr Wang sacked Ms Ayton via text message in April this year, later claiming it was due to her absences and the alleged absence of a small amount of cash in the cash register from $5.10 to $30.
But Mr Sams said Mr Wang's reasons for dismissing Ms Ayton were weak and lacked evidence.
She was absent for only one shift in three years, with the "missing amount" totalling a few Australian dollars.
He said Ms Ayton's dismissal was "not actually related to her conduct or performance."

"It seems to me that the respondent's real motivation for dismissing her, supported by the evidence of the job advertisement released by Mr Wang, was that he preferred to hire staff with an Asian background," he said.
Mr Wong's actions, under section 772 (f) of the Fair Work Act, would ostensibly constitute an unlawful breach of anti-discrimination laws and / or the dismissal of the applicant, "it said.
Mr Sams said it was not appropriate for him to consider reinstating her, given the "appalling" treatment of Ms Ayton by Mr Wang.
He should consider paying compensation to Ms Ayton, who is a casual worker on an hourly salary of A $26.

In light of possible breaches of anti-discrimination and industrial relations legislation, Mr Sams said he would refer his own rulings and documents to council chiefs to consider whether Mr Wang's actions should be referred to other agencies to investigate possible breaches of state or federal law.
He said Mr Wang had not given Ms Ayton any opportunity to respond to the alleged grounds for her dismissal.

"I believe the respondent engaged in an irredeemably unfair and biased process to dismiss the applicant and Mr Wang" waited "for the opportunity, which he believed would 'justify' terminating the employment of the applicant," he said.
"He was wrong... The respondent completely disregarded giving the applicant any natural justice when he dismissed her, shocking her with his disrespectful and grossly unfair perfunctory behaviour."

Mr Sams said that while Foodworks was a small business, "it must be said frankly that no decent employer would ever dismiss an employee in the extremely unfair and perfunctory way that this case acknowledges."
"It's disgraceful and it's extremely unfair," he said.

Song Tao, chief engineer of the shaft area of the Dashu Project Department of the China Railway Tunnel Bureau, said: "The successful completion of the first shaft of the Gaoligongshan Tunnel will help push forward the construction of the underground yard, opening up many working faces for the later construction of the sinkhole and leveling, and speeding up the construction of the entire Gaoligongshan Tunnel."

Song Tao introduced, Gaoligongshan Tunnel No. 1 shaft construction using drilling method, equipped with drilling derrick, drilling stability, drilling winch, the overall movement of metal templates, FJD-6A type umbrella, center rotating grab equipment and other large-scale specialized machinery, formed a mechanized excavation system, ballast system, suspension system, winch lifting system and other "four systems" mechanized pipeline, such as drilling, blasting, ballast, template installation, concrete pouring, and other complete process mechanization work, greatly accelerated the progress of construction.
It is understood that the Dali to Ruili railway, running from Dali to Ruili in the west, has a total length of 331 km and a design speed of 140 km / h.
The total length of the Gaoligong Mountain Tunnel is 34.538 km, making it the first long tunnel in China.

China is expected to be Australia's largest beef export market.
China is facing severe pork shortages following an African swine fever outbreak and is on track to become Australia's largest beef export market, according to a Rabobank animal protein analyst.

Following the outbreak, Chinese consumers are switching from eating pork to other animal proteins, with the outbreak causing authorities to destroy many herds, halving the number of pigs in China and nearly doubling pork prices in the past year.
China produces and consumes two-thirds of the world's pork.

Chenjun Pan, senior animal-protein analyst for the Dutch bank China Cooperative, says demand for other meats, including beef, has increased, with China, the world's largest animal protein importer, now accounting for 27 per cent of pork imports and 24 per cent of beef imports.
In the first half of this year, China ’ s beef imports from Australia increased by 65%, with China overtaking the US and Japan to become Australia ’ s largest beef export market, according to Ms Pan.
Yesterday, the government said it would release more pork from emergency reserves before celebrating the 70th anniversary of the ruling Communist Party of China.
White Paper: China always puts its own development in the coordinate system of human development
The white paper says that China has always placed its development in the coordinate system of human development and closely linked its own destiny with that of people all over the world.
The white paper says that China promotes world peace and development through its own development.

As the largest developing country in the world, China's unswerving pursuit of its own path and concentrated efforts on its own affairs to make its country richer and its people happier and to inject stability and certainty into a complex and changing world is in itself the greatest contribution to world peace and development.

China in the new era will continue to unswervingly follow the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics under the guidance of Xi Jinping's ideology of socialism with Chinese characteristics in the new era.

China always takes economic construction as the central task for rejuvenation of the country.We will unswervingly follow the road of high-quality development, implement the new development concepts of innovation, coordination, green, openness and sharing, and accelerate the building of a modern economic system to better meet the people's growing needs for a better life.
Let the common people live a good life is always the biggest goal of China's development.
The Chinese army has always been a staunch defender of world peace.
The white paper says that China is committed to win-win cooperation and common development.
"The Chinese people want to live a good life not only for themselves but also for the people of other countries."

China pursues innovation, growth linkages and convergence of interests, promotes the building of high-quality development along the Belt and Road, and promotes poverty reduction and development throughout the world.
"China firmly upholds and promotes economic globalization," the white paper said.
China is an active participant in, and a strong supporter of, economic globalization.
China is ready to take the initiative with the international community to strengthen guidance and make the process of economic globalization more dynamic, inclusive and sustainable.

China will implement a more proactive strategy of opening up, create a more comprehensive, deeper and diversified opening up pattern, achieve a broader mutual benefit and win-win outcome, and safeguard and promote economic globalization with concrete actions.

China firmly opposes unilateralism and protectionism, and the door to opening to the outside world will open wider and wider, accelerate regional economic integration and continue to promote the internationalization of the renminbi.
"China firmly supports multilateralism and upholds international equity and justice," the white paper said.

China will, as always, firmly safeguard the international system with the United Nations at its core and the international order with the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations at its core.
Safeguarding fairness and justice is a basic principle in China's handling of international issues.

China respects the road of development and social system chosen by the people of all countries, respects the sovereignty and territorial integrity of all countries, and opposes interference in the internal affairs of other countries by outside forces.
China will never impose its will on others, and it will never allow anyone to impose their will on the Chinese people.
"China is actively participating in leading the reform and construction of the global governance system," the white paper said.

As a responsible power, China has always stood for the balance of rights and obligations, and has not only witnessed the demands of China's development on the world, but also the expectations of the international community for China to take an active part in the reform and construction of the global governance system.

China energetically supports the UN reform, urges the UN to better adapt to the new requirements of global governance in terms of ideology, institution and operating mode, better fulfill the responsibilities entrusted to it by the UN Charter, and play a bigger role in safeguarding world peace and promoting common development.

China is actively promoting the innovative development of the concept of global governance, taking stock of the successful practices and experiences of state governance in a timely manner, actively exploring the positive ways of life in Chinese culture, sharing the same ideals of governance as the current era, and striving to contribute to the improvement of global governance with Chinese wisdom, Chinese plans and strength.

World's oldest hairdresser dies at the age of 108, 96 years after cutting her hair
Anthony Mancinelli, 108, the world's oldest ever barber, never retired for a haircut, but died 19 days later of complications from jaw cancer.

According to CNN, Mancinelli immigrated to the United States when he was 8 and soon spent time cleaning floors at a barbershop before taking out scissors at age 12 to relieve his family's financial stress.
Mancinelli, though attending elementary school, did not graduate.

Mancinelli's son, Robert, revealed that his father loved his job and was loved by people from all over the world, but his health meant he was diagnosed with cancer in February and was unable to work for six weeks before his death.
Robert, 82, said he had to find a new hairdresser after his father died because he had asked his father to help him cut his hair for the rest of his life.
China Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation Gazette [Issue No.39 2007]

In order to stabilize the company ’ s share price and maintain its image, listed companies have begun to buy back shares frequently in the past two years, hoping to send the message that the company is undervalued to the market through targeted repurchases and pooled trading, thereby stabilizing share prices and boosting investor confidence.
According to Oriental Wealth Choice, the amount of capital used by listed companies to buy back shares was 7.9 billion yuan in 2017, rising to 5.1 billion yuan in 2018.

From the point of view of repurchase, the repurchase of shares seems to be the same as the increase of major shareholders, but there are great differences in the implementation of the subject, the source of funds, the repurchase purpose, the equity of the shares themselves.

Xu Yang, chairman of the Shanghai Mykolong Information Consulting Co. Ltd., told the Securities Daily that the "Opinions on Supporting Listed Companies to Repurchase Shares", introduced in November 2018, addressed the problems of the existing system, such as the narrow scope of share repurchase, complicated decision-making procedures and inadequate inventory system.

In January this year, the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges formally promulgated the Implementation Rules for Listed Companies to Repurchase Shares, and these policies broadened the sources of funds for listed companies to repurchase, appropriately simplified implementation procedures, guided the improvement of governance arrangements, and encouraged various listed companies to implement stock incentives or employee stock ownership plans.

After the opinion is issued, the listed company carries on the operation of the share repurchase, has the more applicable situation, the repurchase process is easier, the share repurchase enthusiasm is also greater.

Buying back shares at a relatively low position is also beneficial to listed companies to increase the efficiency of capital use, thereby increasing the level of earnings per share, raising the return on equity and relieving the pressure on the company's profitability index.

Compared with the majority shareholder, the repurchase of shares of listed companies is more significant, and reflects the willingness of listed companies to actively manage market value and cash flow.

Xuyang believes that the undervalued share price is a major factor in the repurchase of listed companies, and that the company's share price is no longer a reflection of the future development prospects of the company, so such companies deserve investors' attention, but do not blindly invest, need to focus on the financial reports of such listed companies and the specific business situation.
Listed companies with large buybacks at least demonstrate confidence and financial strength in the company's development.

The growing enthusiasm for buybacks among A-share listed companies has also normalized the practice of buybacks, with data showing that nearly a thousand listed companies have carried out share buybacks this year and that leading companies in various sectors have become the dominant force in the repurchase market.

China Ping An recently disclosed the progress of the repurchase, saying that the company has accumulated 57.59 million A-share shares through centralized bidding, accounting for 0.315% of the company's total share capital, with total funds paid amounting to 5 billion yuan (excluding transaction fees).

Yili shares have paid 5.792 billion yuan for share repurchase and recently adjusted the use of repurchase shares, changing from the original plan "to repurchase all shares as a source of stock incentive for later implementation" to "buy back 183 million shares, of which 152 million shares will be used to implement stock incentive sources, and the remaining 30.49 million shares will be written off to reduce registered capital."
Illi said the write-off of some of the repurchased shares will help to further improve the level of earnings per share and improve the investment returns of the company's shareholders.
TCL issued the repurchase progress announcement on September 25, which showed that TCL had repurchased 3.59% of the company's shares at a total cost of 1.65 billion yuan.
The share buyback will be used for employee stock ownership plans, equity incentives or convertible corporate bonds issued by listed companies, the TCL board office told Securities Daily.
TCL adheres to the established operating strategy, constantly improve the competitiveness, and develop healthily and continuously.

Based on confidence in the company's future development and the preservation of investors' interests, combined with the performance of the secondary market in the company's stock market over the past year, and taking into account such factors as the company's business and financial condition, the company plans to use its own capital, self-financing and other fundraising methods to buy back its shares.

Yang Delong, former chief economist at the China Open Source Fund, said the move to buy back shares, which would on the one hand reduce the number of shares in circulation on the market and increase earnings per share for listed companies, was an important boon to secondary market stocks, and the willingness of listed companies to take out real gold and silver on their own initiative and buy back their share write-offs from the stock market had given a big boost to market confidence.

Buybacks for domestic listed companies have been increasing in recent years, particularly for blue-chip stocks, and boosting investor confidence through share buybacks is a very good way to go, and one that deserves recognition and encouragement.

Gansu Qingyang: Lake sheep pack to "get out of poverty".
In the autumn of September, the loess plateau is covered.

In the Yimin culturing cooperative in the town of Pima, the 58-year-old villager Xia Wei filled the trough in the sheep pen with the last shovelful of grass, and stood at the trough, watching the white lake sheep chew.
"Good food, until the autumn and winter fat, out of the column before a good price."
Chavelli said he fed the sheep a daily "special nutritious meal", regularly cleaned, sterilized, careful servitude dare not neglect.
Shaveley kept sheep for more than 20 years until he came to the cooperative to work, only to learn how extensive sheep had been in the past.
Shaveli is the Gansu province Qingyang County post horse town Xuanchi village.
His neighbors are sheep farmers, but adhere to the traditional way of keeping sheep, poor quality sheep, small output.
In June this year, under the guidance of the government, 140 poor families from the village joined the co-operative and everything began to change.
Shaveley spent his days digging deep into farming, because his mind was always suffocating.
The owners of the shares were all poor, and they trusted the sheep to the co-op, and were counting on him to pay dividends and sell them at the end of the year.
Fortunately, with the guidance of technical personnel, he slowly learned to engage in epidemic prevention, mastered scientific feeding, has become a few of the village's farming "good style."
The village is home to a large number of sheep farms, with a total of 16 sheep farms.
Zou Tao, head of the cooperative, said that the standardized sheep shed inside and out, are very doorway.
"The wool is thick, it breeds bacteria. The sheep can't stay in the hot and humid place. The shed must be built on three sides of the ditch and a fan must be installed to ventilate the heat.
Zou Tao said that in order to prevent epidemics, it is also necessary to regularly spray the sheep shed to disinfect them, giving them three to four injections a quarter.
In addition to living well, "little fat sheep" must eat a mixture of silage maize, wheat grass, alfalfa, etc., and have a wide enough "playground" stretch.

Cooperatives have adopted the method of trust breeding, and have guided local farmers in releasing well-bred lake sheep and sheep here for unified raising, management and marketing, so as to realize well-cultured, scientific, standardized and intensive breeding.
Today, 140 poor households with sheep in their shares earn more than 6,000 yuan per household per year.

In Qingyang, Gansu Province, sheep farming is not only a change in feeding methods, but also a change in the model of "leading enterprises + co-operatives + farmers", which has changed the scene of sheep farming on the hillside and selling sheep in the market, overcoming the small size of traditional agriculture and animal husbandry and making the poor days of farmers better because of modernization.

If market prices are weak, local leader Gansu Zhongsheng Agropastoral Development Co., Ltd., will buy it at a market protection price of 27 yuan per kilogram, helping farmers spread market risk, Zou Tao said.

Xu Jianfeng, general counsel of Gansu Zhongsheng Agricultural and Animal Husbandry Development Co., Ltd., said the enterprises have promoted more and more poor households to read the "sheep experience" by providing such services as loan guarantee, sheep supply, order raising, quotation purchasing and unified processing and sales.

In Qingyang, at least 8,200 poor families have achieved stable income growth by "joining" the agricultural and livestock husbandry of Zhongsheng for forage farming, fine seed breeding, scale breeding, slaughter and market sales.
Qingyang is located in the northern agropastoral zone, rich in forage resources.

At present, there are 913 meat-sheep large-scale farms and co-operatives in the city, which have raised more than 5 million meat-sheep, and built two processing lines of 1.3 million meat-sheep slaughtering scale.
French finance minister says tax cuts of more than 10 billion euros next year and calls on Germany to follow suit

Paris (Reuters) - French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday that France will cut taxes by more than 10 billion euros ($10.9 billion) next year and that Germany should keep pace with France's fiscal stimulus to revive the sluggish economy.
Introducing France's 2020 budget, Le Maire said the ECB's latest monetary easing had created an opportunity for governments of member states that could afford to increase investment.

The European Central Bank cut interest rates to record lows on September 12 and plans to restart debt purchases in an effort to drive down borrowing costs in hopes of spurring economic recovery and pushing up inflation.
"Low interest rates will not return Europe to prosperity, and monetary policy measures are necessary but not sufficient," Le Maire told reporters.
"Germany needs to invest, now, sooner rather than later," he added.
He has made this appeal to Germany on several occasions.
France has already implemented tax cuts worth more than €10 billion this year, providing a big boost to its economic growth.
And the global economy has lost momentum, with export-dependent Germany bearing the brunt.
Le Maire pointed out that the tax burden on French households will be reduced by €9.3 billion next year, including €5 billion in income tax relief.
In addition, the corporate tax burden will be reduced by nearly €1 billion over a five-year period as the company tax rate will be phased in from 33.3 per cent to 25 per cent.

Study: National Healthy Eating Index slightly up but still challenging - CNBC
A new study shows a moderate increase in the US government's healthy eating index from 56 to 58 over the past 16 years.
But when the full score is 100, it's not something to celebrate.
Americans still face "significant challenges" in their diet.

One of the study's authors, Dr. Fangfang Zhang, a nutrition researcher at Tufts University in Massachusetts, said Americans still eat too much food that could trigger heart disease, diabetes and obesity, which are among the most common ailments in the nation.
The study was published online April 24 in the Journal of the American Medical Association.
The study is based on findings from a U.S. government health survey of 4.4 million adults conducted from 1999 to 2016.
"Despite significant improvements, significant dietary challenges remain," the authors wrote.
The challenges include reducing the amount of saturated fat in snacks, hot dogs, fat cows and butter.
The study found that people ’ s daily intake of these unhealthy fats increased from 11.5% to 12%, exceeding the recommended limit of 10%.
The greatest improvement in the American diet has been a reduction in sugar intake from 16% to about 14%, but still too high.
Officially, the intake of added sugar in the diet should be less than 10%.

As for the reason for the decrease in sugar intake, the researchers believe it is related to the reduction in people drinking sweetened sodas, but Zhang stressed that sugars are often added to even less sweet foods such as yoghurt and ketchup.
Adults in the United States have seen a small increase in their intake of fruits, nuts, oats, and other whole grain types.
Still, 2016 data show that these foods still account for less than 5% of the daily diet.

Despite a slight reduction in salt intake, and a reduction in fruit juices leading to lower carbohydrate intake, Zhang says they still account for up to 42% of daily calories, many of which come from refined white bread and other refined grains.
The study is based on biennial personal health surveys that ask adults to recall what they ate in the past 24 hours.
These health surveys have been asking this question twice every few days since 2003.
Dietary guidelines for U.S. residents issued by the government recommend that people adopt a "healthy eating pattern" to reduce the risk of chronic disease.

The guidelines say people should eat more nutrient-dense foods such as vegetables, fruits, whole grains, low-fat dairy products, and seafood, lean meats, poultry meat, eggs, seeds that provide protein.

The number of Americans with diabetes nearly doubled during the study period, to more than 7%, and obesity rates increased over the many years of the study – about 70% of American adults are now overweight or obese.
In addition, heart disease remains the leading cause of death among U.S. nationals.

China Railway Tunnel shafts record deep

On 27 September, after more than 1,200 days of round-the-clock construction, the construction of the No. 1 shaft of the Gaoligongshan Tunnel of the Jilin Railway was completed on the Jilin Railway (Jili) on the Jilin River.
The 34.5 km DART Gaoligong Mountain Tunnel, which crosses the Gaoligong Mountains from the west bank of the Nu River, is the longest single hole of the Asian double track.
The tunnel runs through 19 fault zones, with a maximum depth of 1,155 metres, because it covers almost all of the possible geology and significant risks associated with tunnel construction.

The shaft is one of the most important auxiliary tunnels in the Gaoligong Mountain Tunnel, with the important tasks of increasing the operational surface to achieve the "short tunnel" and the later railway operation ventilation.
The first shaft was successfully excavated to the bottom of the well, marking the formal entry of the Gaoligong Mountain Tunnel into the horizontal tunnel construction.
"The shaft is all in the granite stratum, because the granite stratum has more fissures, it can not stop the water, flowing from top to bottom, basically how deep the water pressure is."
During the construction of the shaft, there were many dangers such as mud surge, collapse, etc. The construction party invited experts on the spot to study the treatment scheme more than 20 times.

"When the inlet water in the shaft is at its maximum, it reaches more than 300 cubic meters per hour, more than 700 meters deep at the bottom of the well, and the water pressure is equivalent to 700 meters deep at the bottom of the sea," the statement said.
"If we don't drain and drain in time, we will flood the well 10 meters in an hour, nearly 85 percent of the time, and 15 percent of the time," said Si.

In order to overcome the geological problems of longitudinal joint development, mud-surge water and water-enriched granite, the tunnel construction adopts the method of systematic water control combining "exploration, injection and excavation" to reduce the construction risk.
After many improvements, the No. 1 shaft was constructed to form a mechanical pipeline, such as a excavation system, a ballast system, a suspension system, a winch lift system, and so on.
After more than 1,200 days of construction, the shaft was successfully completed at a depth of 762.59 m.
With a length of 330 km, it is an important part of the China-Myanmar international corridor and an important transportation infrastructure for carrying out the "Belt and Road" construction.

When completed and opened to traffic, the travel time between Dali and Ruili will be shortened from six hours to two hours, which will greatly improve the transportation pattern in the western Yunnan region and promote the economic and trade cooperation and friendly exchanges between China and the Southeast Asian countries.
Mrs Lam: As a Chinese, I am proud of my country's achievements
The Hong Kong press celebrated its 70th anniversary.
"Hong Kong Press Celebrates the 70th Anniversary of the People's Republic of China" is held in Hong Kong.

Speaking at the reception, the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, Mrs Carrie Lam, pointed out that the achievements of the country over the past 70 years have been witnessed by all, and we are proud to be Chinese.

Mrs Lam, the Deputy Director of the Liaison Office of the Central Government in Hong Kong, Mr Lu Xinning, the Deputy Commissioner of the Office of the Commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Hong Kong, Mr Song Ru-an, the Deputy Political Commissar of the People's Liberation Army in Hong Kong, Mr Chen Yadin, and the Chairman of the Executive Committee of the Hong Kong Media Committee for the National Day celebrations attended the reception and officiated.

'In the past 70 years, China has made great strides forward, and even though it has faced many difficult challenges, it has overcome all of them, and we as Chinese are proud of our achievements, 'she said.
Since its return to the motherland, Hong Kong has been closely linked with the Mainland, making progress together and sharing the fruits.

We believe that on the premise of "one country, two systems", Hong Kong can continue to play its role in taking advantage of the opportunities of "One Belt, One Road" and the Greater Bay Area of Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau to seek a better future for Hong Kong.
She added that every Hong Kong citizen had been affected in the past few months by ongoing social disputes and that journalists faced different challenges.

At this critical juncture, we hope that our friends in the media will continue to rise to the occasion, uphold professionalism, make fair and balanced news coverage for the community, and contribute to the future of Hong Kong and the re-emergence of a rational communication dialogue.

Jiang pointed out in his speech that the glorious journey of the new China is also a journey of common development, common progress, blood ties and common disgrace between Hong Kong and the motherland.

Since the return of Hong Kong to the motherland in particular, the Central Government has unswervingly carried out the principles of "one country, two systems", "Hong Kong people in running Hong Kong" and a high degree of autonomy.
To this end, the Hong Kong press gathered to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.
He said that in the past three months, Hong Kong has witnessed a series of violent activities that flagrantly violate the law and undermine social stability.
He called on the media to agitate and create a good atmosphere for the people to resist violence and uphold the rule of law.

A professional media professional should abide by the professional norms of the news profession, and use truthful reporting and responsible utterance to guide the public to become self-conscious and violent, and to safeguard the justice and majesty of the law.

About 500 people from all walks of life, including the Hong Kong press, attended the reception and joined the officiating guests in raising their glasses to toast the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.

Correspondents from the Xining Municipal Committee Publicity Department have learned that the Xining Municipality will implement the "Regulations on the Promotion of Civilized Conduct" on October 1, focusing on 15 kinds of uncivil behavior such as pedestrians not following traffic lights and throwing objects from buildings.

British tourist's car keys fall into lake - family stranded in France for five days

A Welsh couple taking their two children on a holiday to France recently accidentally dropped their car keys into a lake and the family were forced to wait five days to get a new key made by the carmaker.
The couple then left France with their children.
The British family were visiting a lake in France on September 16 when their daughter accidentally knocked over a bag and the car keys inside fell into the lake, according to reports.
But they spent hours and failed to find the key.
All their belongings and cash were locked in the car.
Although the British tourist bought insurance before setting off, the insurance company refused to help on the grounds that the vehicle was not in danger of being stolen.
They hired a tow truck to take the car to a garage for storage and reordered the keys from the carmaker.
A few days later, the British tourist finally got the keys to the concoction, and the couple left France with their children.
Their scheduled trip was cancelled due to the loss of their car keys.

Pilot notification commitment system in areas such as production licenses for low-risk varieties of food and delegation of processing authority from the representative office of foreign enterprises to the free trade area

On 27 July, the Shanghai Municipal Market Supervisory Authority signed a working memorandum with the Pudong New District Government, introducing 20 market regulatory reform measures, some of which are pilot measures in China.

According to the introduction, the notice of commitment means that the administrative organ shall inform the applicant of the conditions and requirements stipulated by laws and regulations in written form when handling the items of licensing registration.
After signing the undertaking, the administrative organ may handle it directly.

According to the memorandum, the Shanghai market supervision department will support the Pudong New Area and the Shanghai FTZ in three areas, namely enterprise name registration, food production licenses for simple and low-risk varieties and approval of some types of measuring instruments, so as to facilitate enterprise access.
Shanghai Shao Wansheng Food Co. Ltd. obtained the Food Production License on the spot by telling the promised way, and became the first enterprise to enjoy the pilot dividend.

The food licence was also handed out on the spot, the head of the company said, and it had taken the form of a “lack of acceptance ”, allowing the company to submit part of its material in accordance with the deadline set out in the letter of commitment.
The Shanghai market supervision department said that the implementation of the food production licensing system for the commitment system as a national pilot.

After the reform, the examination and approval process was narrowed down from the previous six stages of "registration, acceptance, on-site verification, sampling inspection, material examination, examination and approval system" to the three stages of "registration, acceptance, approval and approval system".

In view of the high degree of outward economic development in Pudong, the Shanghai market supervision department has delegated the registration power of the permanent representative offices of foreign enterprises to the Shanghai Free Trade Zone to facilitate the enterprises' handling in the nearest area.

Statistics show that the decentralization involved a total of 1,592 permanent representative offices in the Shanghai Free Trade Area, 99 of which have been handled in accordance with the new regulations.

The mascot will be unveiled at the 2020 Dubai Expo.
The mascot launch ceremony for the 2020 Dubai World Expo was held in Dubai, United Arab Emirates.
The mascot consists of six cartoon characters, including two Emirati children, three flying robots, and an Emirati tree.
The conference introduced the six mascots to the audience by playing short video clips.
Rashid, a 9-year-old boy, and Rafiq, an 8-year-old girl, are brothers and sisters representing the people of the United Arab Emirates.

The three robots correspond to the three subthemes of the Expo, with the blue robot representing "mobility", the green robot representing "sustainability" and the yellow robot representing "opportunity".
Named "Salama" after an ancient beanstalk tree, the five "little ones" symbolize the ancestors who guarded the land.

Ahmed, chairman of the Dubai World Expo High Committee, said the mascots could strengthen the emotional connection between the event and the participants and "believe that the mascot of the Dubai World Expo will convey the traditional spirit of telling stories, showcasing the creativity of local talent and expressing our ambitions and expectations".

The launch was attended by the Vice President and Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, Sheikh Mohammed, Crown Prince Hamdan of Dubai, the Minister of State for International Cooperation of the United Arab Emirates, and the Director of the Dubai Expo Bureau, Liam Hashemi.
The Dubai World Expo will be held in Dubai from October 20, 2020 to April 10, 2021, with the theme "Communication, Create the Future".
This will be the first time the Expo will be held in the Middle East.
From next year, Chinese students can apply for German undergraduate degrees on the basis of their college entrance examination results

In Germany, the Anabin database, which evaluates and evaluates foreign diplomas, announced on its website that high school graduates in China will be able to apply for German university degrees without being required to enroll at universities in Germany, starting in 2020.

Prior to this, Chinese high school graduates who wanted to apply to German universities were required to take a semester (211,985) or three semesters (general) of undergraduate studies in their home country and pass APS or TestAS exams.
The new rules may save at least half a year for Chinese students wishing to study in Germany.
It is understood the new rules will come into force in late 2019.

Applicants are required to: complete 12 years of regular compulsory education and obtain a high school diploma; sit for the baccalaureate and the university entrance examination, with a score of 70% or more of the total score (525 or more if the total score is 750), and include two language grades and a grade in mathematics or natural sciences.
In addition, the specific requirements for college entrance examination results vary.

For example, to apply for a major in medicine, oral medicine, veterinary medicine, pharmacy, etc., a college entrance score of 80% is required, and the college entrance examination subjects must include at least two in mathematics, physics, chemistry, and biology, or take an ensemble.
According to incomplete statistics, a number of countries, including Germany, the United Kingdom, Canada, Australia, and other countries have recognized China's college entrance examination results.

In the United Kingdom, for example, universities such as Cambridge University, Birmingham University and the University of Leicester accept applications from Chinese students based on their entrance examination results.

Cirque du Soleil has said it is in talks with Boston Dynamics, which is developing the robot, to discuss the feasibility of using the robot in circus performances.
The four-legged robot Spot, a 14kg mobile robot with high cross-country mobility, 360-degree obstacle avoidance, navigation, remote control and autonomy, was unveiled by Boston Dynamics on Tuesday.
In particular, Spot has a proprietary software platform specifically developed for Spot, which allows users to customize Spot's functionality through various applications.
Boston Dynamics first published the concept of the robot dog in 1992, causing a stir, but it has not yet been used commercially.
However, Boston Dynamics pointed out that Spot had entered the production phase, with the majority of orders coming from the construction and energy industries.

In addition, Cirque du Soleil is currently in contact with Boston Dynamics, and Cirque du Soleil says the project is still in the conceptual stage and is evaluating the potential of Spot for use in the show.
State Council Information Office Releases White Paper on China and the World in a New Age

On the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, the Information Office of the State Council issued a white paper entitled "China and the World in a New Age" on the 27th.

Xu Lin, Vice Minister of the Ministry of Central Propaganda and Director of the Information Office of the State Council, said the white paper focused on such issues as "where China comes from and where it goes", "what kind of world China promotes and builds", and "how a developing China can relate to the world".
"Over the past 70 years, under the leadership of the CPC, China has undergone earth-shaking changes and created a development miracle unprecedented in the history of mankind," the white paper says.
The white paper gives an account of China's tremendous achievements, great significance and world contributions over the past 70 years in terms of statistics and facts.
The white paper says that China took decades to complete the centuries-long development process of the developed countries, and its economy now ranks second in the world in terms of volume.

The white paper says that over the past 70 years, the Chinese people have built a new world from scratch, become self-reliant and work hard, and through their interaction with the world, China has embraced the world, learned from the world and contributed to the world.

"The white paper says that the success of China's development over the past 70 years lies in the fact that, under the leadership of the Communist Party of China, the Chinese people have found the correct path of development of socialism with Chinese characteristics and have steadfastly followed it.

The white paper stresses that the road to socialism with Chinese characteristics is a road established in the light of the national conditions of the country, a road that puts the interests of the people first, a road of reform and innovation, a road that seeks common development in opening up and a road that runs under the rule of law in an all-round way.
China's development path, in line with its national conditions and in line with the requirements of the times, will increasingly show bright prospects for development as the times advance.

In response to the concern of the international community over China's development, the white paper stresses that achieving national prosperity and strength, national rejuvenation and people's happiness are not only the dream of the Chinese people but also the common dream of people of all countries.

The white paper points out that China is a major stabilizer and power source of world economic growth, that opening up in all directions creates more opportunities for development in all countries, that China provides more public goods to the international community, and that China provides experience and lessons for other developing countries.
Faced with the question of what is going on in the world and what is to be done by mankind, the white paper points out that today's world is undergoing unprecedented changes.
China's proposal to build a community of human destiny and open up a new development path of win-win cooperation and joint construction and sharing provides a new choice for human development.

The white paper calls on all countries to unite to build a new type of international relations, promote a new type of economic globalization, safeguard the international system with the United Nations at its core, promote exchanges and mutual learning among civilizations, and work together to build a community of human destiny and a better world.
With the increasing development of China, the international community has paid more and more attention to the development of China to get along with the world.
"The white paper says that China cannot develop without the world, and the world cannot develop in peace, prosperity and stability without China.

China has always placed self-development in the human development coordinate system, insists on cooperation for win-win and common development, insists on maintaining and promoting economic globalization, actively develops global partnership, firmly supports multilateralism, upholds international equity and justice, promotes joint building of "Belt and Road" high-quality development, actively participates in leading the reform and construction of the global governance system, and remains a world peace builder, contributor to global development and defender of international order.
At present, China has entered a new era of development.

"The white paper says that in the new era, China's determination to take the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics will not change, its determination to learn from and cooperate with other countries to achieve win-win results will not change, and its determination to join hands with the rest of the world will not change.
The white paper concludes by stating that the future and destiny of nations in today's world have never been more closely linked.
The white paper, China and the World in the New Age, consists of a preface, text and concluding remarks, with 29,000 words.

Published in eight languages, including Chinese, English, French, Russian, German, Spanish, Arabic and Japanese, the white paper is published separately by the People's Publishing House and the Foreign Language Publishing House.
Does MCA go to Johor to contest the by-election?
The president of the MCA, Dato 'Seri Weijixiang: "Discuss with the Supreme Council of JSPB!"
Whether MCA, a member of BN, comes to power in the coming by-election is a matter of concern.

However, after the meeting of the MCA Central Committee, it was announced that it would be up to the Supreme Council of BN to decide whether the MCA traditional seat would continue to be held by MCA or be replaced by other MCA member parties.

After chairing a meeting of the MCA Central Committee on Thursday afternoon, Wei Jiaxiang told the media that any by-election would be held in accordance with the standard operating procedures (SOP), which require a meeting of the MCA Supreme Council.
He said the meeting of the Supreme Council of BN was expected to take place in early October, as the election committee will not meet until next Monday.
"Yesterday morning, I also met the Chairman of BN, Dato 'Seri Ahmad Zahi, and we all agreed on the need to regain the seat from the Coalition of Hope."
"We have finalised a special meeting of BN leaders in early October and the leader of BN's three parties will determine which of them will take up the post," he said.

Asked whether the MCA would insist on standing for the traditional seat in the Supreme Council of BN, Mr Wei reiterated that, as MCA president, he must act in accordance with standard operating procedures and that any decision must therefore meet the consensus of BN.
"In any by-election, it is not uncommon for people to be willing to go out and have a party, a party, think they should come out," he said.
"The most important thing is what kind of organization and political alliance do we come from?
"This is a big test of our political alliances over the years, and we believe that BN has come along with some valuable values."
"In the process, it's possible that someone will say something, that's to be expected," the source added.
"But once the Supreme Council of BN has made its decision, it is most valuable that we have to prepare for the war."
In any case, Mr Wei said, MCA would do its best to prepare for the upcoming Danyue by-election on three levels, namely, the District Council, the State Council and the Central Committee.

"The District Council will be headed by the Chairman of the District Council (Tanjung Piai), Dato 'Serriang' Day; the State Council will be led by the Acting Chairman of the Johor Board, Dato 'Lim Pei-hing; and the Central Committee will be led by the Acting Chairman of the General Council, Dato' Mahanshun ', and General Secretary, Dato' Shing 'Cheung."

A villager in Baokang County, Hubei Province, who hunted wild animals was ordered to "voluntarily patrol the mountains"

A villager in Baokang County, Hubei Province, was sentenced to prison for hunting wild animals and ordered to pay 15,420 yuan (RMB, same) in compensation for ecological resources and environmental damage.

Due to the indigence of the defendants' families, the procuratorial organs have introduced alternative labor to compensate for the ecological rehabilitation costs, thus realizing the organic unification of legal and social effects.

The defendant, Zhou Mou, had established deep feelings with the wild macaque and blamed himself for the hunting of the animals through three months of alternative labor, said Wang Zhongliang, deputy attorney general of Baokang County Prosecutor's Office.
On June 21 this year, the Baokang County Prosecutor's Office filed a civil lawsuit in the area of ecological resources.

The defendant, Zhou, was sentenced to three years' imprisonment, four years' probation and a fine of 3,000 yuan, while being ordered to pay 15,420 yuan for the restoration of ecological resources and environmental damage.
As of January 2014, more than 20 wild animals have been hunted, including gazelle, muntjac, and woolly deer.
The zebra is a national endangered species, and the small muntjac and woolly deer are listed on the National Terrestrial Wildlife Protection List.
During the trial, Zhou confessed to his illegal facts and conduct and was willing to bear the incidental civil liability.

However, in view of the poor economic situation of Zhou ’ s family, under the coordination of the Baokang County Procurator ’ s Office, the local village committee, Lin ’ s station and Zhou ’ s tripartite agreement on the compensation of ecological rehabilitation costs for alternative labor was concluded: Zhou ’ s efforts to provide pro bono labor to cover the ecological rehabilitation costs by conducting macaque training and conservation work in village macaque reserves, voluntary mountain patrols, and forest protection for one year.
The court accepted the prosecutor's recommendation, agreeing to Zhou's reprieve while actively fulfilling his obligation to "replace labor to compensate for ecological rehabilitation costs".
At present, Zhou has been in the macaque protected area of 3 months of voluntary work, active tour of the mountains, good performance.

In recent years, the Baokang County Prosecutor's Office has integrated the functions of prosecutorial and social governance into its practice, using scientific methods of prosecutorial, investigative and prosecutorial supervision to minimize the damage to the ecological environment caused by criminal acts through judicial means.
UN awards Defender of the Earth Award for 'Ant Forest'

To rapturous applause and loud music, Xu Di, head of the “Ant Forest ” project, and Shen Junliang, a user representative, took the podium and took the 2019 United Nations Champions of the Earth trophy from the moderator.

The Ant Forest project, which uses mobile phone apps to engage hundreds of millions of people in environmental activism, was awarded the "Incentive and Action Award" at the 2019 Champions of the Earth Awards in New York.
A week ago, the United Nations Environment Programme had announced the winners at its headquarters in the Kenyan capital, Nairobi.

"The Ant Forest is an exciting innovation that allows hundreds of millions of people to move on to understand the environmental challenges facing humanity and what it can do for the environment," UNEP Executive Director Yinghe Annosen told Xinhua.
It would have a huge impact by connecting people and the environment with technology and enabling every individual to participate in efforts to protect the planet.

Ant Forest was launched on the Alipay platform in August 2016 by the Ant Financial Services Group of China, with users saving "green energy" through low-carbon actions such as logging their daily green trips in the "Ant Forest", paying for water and electricity online, and "planting trees" on their mobile phones.
For every fictitious tree that users develop, "ant forests" and pro bono partners plant a real tree in a desertified area.
By August this year, 500 million "ant forest" users had accumulated a carbon reduction of 7.92 million tons and planted 122 million trees in desertified areas.

Costa Rica's Carlos Alvarado, who was present to receive the Defender of the Earth award for his country's environmental efforts, praised the "ant forest" for its "impressive ability to inspire so many people to take part in green operations".
Yukio Ii, Ant's chairman and chief executive, said the award was a recognition of the Ant Forest project.
Technology and open platforms make it possible for everyone to participate in a low-carbon life, and the honor belongs to all participants.
Mr Ii said the ant forests had affected 500 million people in the past three years and the goal was to bring one billion people from around the world into low-carbon action in the next three years.
While combating desertification and protecting the environment, they are also exploring how farmers can derive more of their income from the mountains.

In addition to providing employment opportunities through tree planting, it is also hoped to help farmers achieve income growth through agricultural product development projects and electricity trading platforms.
Ant Forest ’ s model of public-interest environmental protection, based on digital technology, has also been successful in reaching out to the sea, where it can be emulated by other countries.
In June, GCash, the Philippines' largest e-wallet, launched the Philippines' version of Ant Forest, which encourages Filipino users to better protect the environment through low-carbon living.
GCash plans to plant 365,000 trees in the Philippines in the first year of the project, it said.
The Champions of the Earth Award is the highest award of the United Nations in the field of environmental protection.

Ant Forest won the award for the third year in a row for the Green Innovation Project in China, following the "Thousand Villages Demonstration and Wancun Management" project in Zhejiang Province, China, and the "Incentive and Action Award".
Economic and trade frictions affect the US economic "report card".

America's economic "report card" for the second quarter of this year showed a marked slowdown in gross domestic product growth from the previous quarter, hurt by a plunge in private-sector investment and exports.
Analysts point to economic and trade frictions and the uncertainty that they create as the main cause of private-sector investment and exports falling in the second quarter.

According to the Commerce Department ’ s final revision, published on May 26, US GDP grew at an annual rate of 2% in the second quarter, about the same as previously announced revisions, but significantly lower than the 3.1% pace of the first quarter.
Data showed that consumption growth became the main factor underpinning U.S. economic growth in the second quarter.
Personal consumption spending, which accounts for about 70% of the US economy, grew by 4.6% in the quarter, boosting growth by 3.03 percentage points.
In addition, government consumer spending and investment contributed 0.82 percent to the economy's growth.

However, private-sector investment fell 6.3% in the second quarter from the previous quarter, dragging down growth by 1.16 percentage points; exports fell 5.7% from the previous quarter, and net exports weighed on growth by 0.68 percentage points.

Barry Knapp, managing partner at Enside Macroeconomic Consulting, said private-sector investment had not been able to sustain last year's growth but had fallen sharply because of the impact of economic and trade frictions and rising uncertainty on business confidence.
Mr Knapp said US corporate capital spending was expected to remain in decline next year amid policy uncertainty.

Analysts believe that while consumption growth provided a strong support for the US economy in the second quarter, there are growing signs that economic and trade frictions and the uncertainty they have created have affected consumer confidence and adversely affected the US consumer outlook.

In the latest survey, 38 percent of consumers spontaneously mentioned the negative effects of tariffs on the U.S. economy, the highest percentage in a year and a half, said Richard Curtin, an economics professor at the University of Michigan who led the survey.
As for the future of the U.S. economy, analysts generally expect the U.S. economy to continue to slow.
But some experts say the performance of the US industrial sector and financial markets will improve if economic and trade frictions ease.
Kathleen Burch, a global economist at the Economist Intelligence Unit, predicts the U.S. economy will continue its downward trend this year, falling to a lower pace than in the second quarter.
Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moody ’ s Analytics, predicts that US growth will slow to 2.3% this year and 1.6% next, assuming that economic and trade frictions do not continue to escalate.
According to Alan Harzen, investment manager at Putnam Investments, the biggest concern of companies today is the economic and trade disputes and the resulting uncertainty.
Miller-Tabak Asset Management equity strategist Matt Melly said economic and trade frictions remain the "top issue" and a major cause of this year's volatility in the U.S. capital markets.
In Ningxia, parents of children aged 0 to 3 who have initiated a couple's shared parental leave may take 10 days off each year
Safeguarding women's legitimate rights and interests is the embodiment of respecting and safeguarding human rights and an important symbol of the progress of social civilization.

At the 15th session of the Standing Committee of the Standing Committee of the 12th National People's Congress of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region on September 27, the Regulations on the Protection of the Rights and Interests of Women in the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region were passed with a large number of votes.
This is the first local decree enacted at the provincial level in Ningxia to comprehensively and systematically safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of women.

As far as I know, the Regulations were revised on the basis of the Measures for the Implementation of the Law of the People's Republic of China on the Protection of Rights and Interests of Women in Ningxia in 2007, and are divided into nine chapters and 65 articles, including the General Provisions, Political Rights, Cultural and Educational Rights and Interests, Labour and Social Security Rights and Interests, Property Rights and Interests, Personal Rights, Marriage and Family Rights and Interests, Legal Liabilities and Supplementary Provisions.
In the Ordinance, Ningxia encourages the exploration of joint parental leave for couples, the first of its kind in the country.

In April this year, the General Office of the State Council issued Guidelines for the Development of Child Care Services for Children under the Age of 3 with a related description of shared parenthood.

In the course of the revision of the Regulations in Ningxia, it was proposed that "the employing units should be encouraged to grant, for couples with children raised in accordance with the provisions of laws and regulations, ten days of joint parental leave each year to each of the spouses during the period from 0 to 3 years of age".
At the same time, the Regulations highlight the fight against sexual harassment and the protection of female minors.

Article 43 of the Regulations incorporates the latest legislative achievements in the compilation of the personal rights of the current Civil Code of China, specifying the constituent elements of sexual harassment and the body and mechanism for combating sexual harassment.

Article 44 of the Regulations expressly prohibits the frequent sexual assault of girls and requires educational institutions to carry out related educational, protective and preventive work, thus becoming a new benchmark in local legislation for the protection of girls.

With regard to the right of women to know and dispose of the joint property of marriage and family, article 35 of the Regulations clearly stipulates the right of women to know about joint property and the obligations of property registration agencies and related subjects, providing solid institutional support for women's rights protection.

In addition, in response to the hot issue of gender discrimination in employment, section 26 of the Regulations prohibits not only direct discrimination but also indirect discrimination, draws on the latest practical experience of joint interviews, strengthens the punishment for violations of gender discrimination, and more vigorously upholds the legitimate rights and interests of women.

In recent years, the Ningxia Women's Federation, together with the Public Prosecution and Law Department and the Civil Affairs Department, has made remarkable progress in promoting and introducing social and professional participation in the mediation of marital and family conflicts and in the fight against domestic violence.

The Regulations summarize and promote this issue, and in a number of laws and regulations encourage the mobilization of social forces and the accumulation of social resources to jointly safeguard women's rights and interests, and require people's governments at and above the county level to provide stable and institutional safeguards and support through the purchase of services.

After marathon debates and weeks of protests, the bill to legalize abortion was passed in NSW on September 26, local time, the Australian Network reported.

It is understood the bill has sparked political debate in the past eight weeks and there have been serious divisions within the Australian Liberal Party since independent MPs announced its introduction in Greenwich.

After nearly 40 hours of discussion, the Senate of the Australian state of New Zealand voted 26 to 14 to legalize abortion, making it the third longest running bill in the new state Senate, the report said.
26, the morning after a final vote in the state's House of Representatives legalized abortion in the new state.
The bill would allow a woman to terminate a pregnancy at 22 weeks of pregnancy if two doctors agree, and also allow a woman to have an abortion later in the pregnancy.

The Senate passed an amendment on the night of the 25th to allow doctors who perform abortions for women after 22 weeks of pregnancy to seek advice from a multi-disciplinary panel of the hospital's advisory committee.
Also among the amendments passed by the Senate is that doctors must provide proper care for babies who survive after terminating their pregnancy.

Previously, the new state's governor, Berejiklian, who has faced open criticism from conservatives over the bill, intervened several times to secure more debate time for the bill, but she did not attend the final vote.
Ms Berejiklian defended her absentee ballot, saying: "I need to spend time managing the whole new state."
Liberal Senator David Davis, one of the most vocal opponents of the legislation, has threatened to withdraw from the new state government, calling it a "government crisis".
But after that, Davis relented.
"The contents of the amendment to the bill legalizing abortion, which was presented to the House on the morning of the 26th, actually provide additional safeguards for women, doctors," Davis said.
Meanwhile, the leader of Australia's NSW National Party, Barry Laro, said he was proud to be part of a government that decriminalised abortion.
"What we achieved last night is historic for the new state, which decriminalizes abortion, decriminalizes abortion, and does not treat women who have abortions as criminals," he said.

Minister of Finance Liu Kun: 67 enterprises and financial institutions have transferred 88.01 billion yuan of state capital to enrich the social security fund.

So far, 67 central enterprises and financial institutions have completed the transfer of some state capital to augment the social security fund, bringing the total to 8601 billion yuan, said Liu Kun, the finance minister.

Liu Kun is the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the SASAC jointly convened the National Transfer of some state capital to strengthen the work of the Social Security Fund at the meeting to make the above statement.

"The transfer of part of the state-owned capital to replenish the social security fund is an important step to reform and improve the basic old-age insurance system, a full reflection of the development of state-owned enterprises by the whole people and the intergenerational equity of the basic old-age insurance system.

In 2017, the Department of State issued an implementation plan for the transfer of part of the state capital to augment the social security fund, which required the selection of some central enterprises and some provinces for the pilot.
According to Liu Kun, the transfer of the previous phase of work has achieved positive results.

At the central level, the transfer work has been completed in three batches for a total of 67 central enterprises and central financial institutions, with a total transfer of state capital of 88.01 billion yuan.
The transfer of the central financial institutions, in which the Ministry of Finance performs the role of contributor, has been basically completed.
Central enterprises have been transferred to a certain scale.
At the local level, pre-transfer work has been carried out successively.
By the end of 2018, the pilot projects in Zhejiang and Yunnan provinces were nearly completed, with state capital transferred to 15.8 billion yuan and 18.5 billion yuan respectively.
In addition to the pilot provinces, other provinces have also carried out pre-transfer preparations, laying the foundation for the implementation of the next step.

According to a joint circular issued recently by the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the SASAC, the State Administration of Taxation and the CSRC, the transfer of part of the state capital to the central and local governments to augment the social security fund will be completed in 2019 and will be completed by 2020.
The meeting held on that day made specific arrangements for a full roll-out.
Emphasis was placed on the need to accomplish the transfer in a pragmatic and efficient manner.
"According to the schedule, the transfer should be basically completed by the end of 2020.
Shift work time is tight, the task is heavy.

Liu Kun said that all regions and departments should meticulously organize and meticulously arrange to ensure that the transfer work is completed as required; make solid progress in the transfer work and accurately grasp the policy contents; and strengthen communication and coordination to resolve difficult issues in a timely manner.
The purpose of the transfer is to provide strong support for the old-age security system, starting from the point of "enriching the coffers of the Social Security Fund".
However, I believe that this is not a simple "physical displacement" of equity, but opened "the addition of mathematics."

On September 20, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of People's Affairs, the SASAC, the State Administration of Taxation and the CSRC jointly issued the Notice on the Full Realization of the Work of Transferring Part of the State-Owned Capital to Enrich the Social Security Fund, setting out the timetable for the transfer of state-owned capital to enlarge the Social Security Fund.
After the publication of the document, the Ministry of Finance and other departments were also quick to implement.
On September 25, the Ministry of Finance transferred all 10% of ICBC and Agribank's holdings to the Social Security Fund, with the total value of the two transfers exceeding 115 billion yuan.
According to the regulations, as financial investors, the social security fund and other undertakers enjoy the right to gain, dispose and know the information of the State-owned equity.
ICBC and ABC said in the announcement that the change in equity will not result in the change of the bank's controlling shareholder and the actual controller.
In this regard, the author believes that similar state-owned enterprise equity transfer is not a simple change in equity ownership, but can stimulate a series of effects "addition operation."

The first step in the transfer of some state capital to social security is, naturally, to reflect the ownership of state-owned enterprises by the whole people and to share the benefits of development with the whole people.
After years of reform and development, state-owned enterprises (SOEs), especially the central enterprises, are in important industries and fields in our country's economy.
Among them, the leading enterprises are continuing to achieve excellence, large and strong.
On July 10, the executive meeting of the State Council decided to fully push forward the transfer of some of the state-owned capital to enrich the work of the Social Security Fund.

The Ministry of Finance immediately said that it would work with relevant departments to fully push aside and transfer some of the state-owned capital to enrich the social security fund, in accordance with the State Council ’ s executive meetings, so as to fully reflect the basic old-age insurance system ’ s intergenerational equity and the results of state-owned enterprises ’ development to be shared by all.
The second step is to enhance the sustainability of China's Social Security Fund and further strengthen the basis of the old-age social security system.

With the aging of the population, China's social security funds are under pressure, and the current transfer of the majority of the state capital, with the ability to continue profits and dividends, not only effective replenishment of social security funds, but also provide a source of funds.

Some estimates show that for every 3.8 percentage points of state-owned capital transferred, the rate of contribution to support enterprise basic pension insurance can be reduced by 1 percentage point.
The third "addition result" is to add a stabilizer to the capital market.
The transfer of the main proceeds of the way is "dividends first, operation as a subsidiary."
As a financial investor of state-owned capital, the Social Security Fund is indeed dominated by equity dividends.
However, as a value investor in the capital market, social security funds have a strong ability of capital operation.

As for the listed assets in the state-owned capital, the participation of social security funds in the shareholding will further optimize the corporate governance structure of listed enterprises, which will be conducive to the improvement of the operating level of enterprises and have a positive impact on listed companies and the capital market.
At the same time, the Social Security Fund as an investment vane, the weight of equity holdings to further enhance its impact in the market, and the role of the "stabilizer".
In addition, it is also helpful to give full play to the "value discovery" function of institutional investors, and to guide them to invest rationally and invest in value.

U.S. Senate approves Scalia as labor secretary - Xinhua - RT America
Washington, September 26 (Xinhua) -- U.S. Senate voted on September 26 to approve President Trump's nomination of Eugene Scalia as Secretary of Labor.
The vote was 53 for and 44 against, with no Democrat voting for Scalia.
Republicans believe Scalia's resume makes him a good fit to be secretary of labor.
But in the Democrats "view, Scalia has long stood on the opposite side of workers and unions in his career as a lawyer.
Scalia will replace Alexander Acosta.

Acosta, then the labor secretary, resigned in July under intense pressure from public opinion after being accused of offering “leniency ” to American billionaire Jeffrey Epstein, who was accused of sexually assaulting and abducting young girls.
Scalia, 56, was a partner in a prominent U.S. law firm whose father was the late Antonin Scalia, justice of the U.S. Supreme Court.
The Department of Labor is the cabinet-level department of the United States federal government responsible for labour-related matters.
The White House also issued a statement the same day that Trump had nominated Acting Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency Peter Geithner to formally lead the agency.
By procedure, Geithner's nomination must still be approved by the Senate.

The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), part of the Department of Homeland Security, coordinates federal resources to deal with natural disasters, terrorist attacks, and other emergencies in the United States.

Iran Is Proved to Develop Advanced Centrifuges Further Suspension of Implementation of Iran Nuclear Deal

(China Central News Agency) The United Nations International Atomic Energy Agency said on the 26th that Iran has violated the Iran nuclear deal once again by using advanced centrifuges to enrich uranium, China Central News Agency reported.

It has been reported that Iran is gradually violating the limits of the Iran nuclear deal, in response to US President Donald Trump ’ s withdrawal from the deal in May 2018 and the reintroduction and tightening of sanctions against Iran.
Iran suspended two other commitments in July, namely, to keep its stock of enriched uranium below 300 kg and to not exceed 3.67%.

Under the nuclear deal, Iran will only be able to build about 5,000 first-generation IR-1 centrifuges at Natanz to accumulate enriched uranium, and will only be allowed to use a small number of more advanced aircraft for research, but will not produce enriched uranium.
If Iran succeeds in developing more advanced centrifuges, it will be able to enrich uranium several times faster, possibly for use in a nuclear bomb.
"On September 25, the Agency confirmed that Iran's advanced centrifuges for the Type 2 and Type 3 aircraft... are accumulating or are ready to accumulate enriched uranium," the IAEA report said.
"They are working at the Natanz facility," said a diplomatic official responding to the report from the International Atomic Energy Agency.

Xiao said that in recent years, China-Indonesia relations have made great strides forward, with growing political mutual trust, pragmatic cooperation and extensive exchanges in various fields.
China has constantly upgraded its relations with ASEAN, and always stood for mutual respect, understanding, trust and support.

Xiao said that the fundamental change in the development of New China over the past 70 years is that the Chinese people, under the leadership of the CPC, have created and developed the road of socialism with Chinese characteristics.

This road is in keeping with the trend of the times, suits China's national conditions, profoundly changes the destiny of the Chinese people and the Chinese nation, makes major contributions to the peaceful development of the world and the region, and is a path that can be followed, is right and leads a good way to a strong country.
The picture shows the theme parade celebrating the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.

Xiao said that China, Indonesia and ASEAN will always work together in partnership to build a new international relationship, promote the building of a community of human destiny, and make new and greater contributions bilaterally, regionally and to the world.
Guests watched a video reviewing 70 years of great achievements in New China and reflecting on China-Indonesia, China-ASEAN relations.
Divided into "China's brilliant development achievements", "China-Indonesia relations to stabilize the distance", "China-ASEAN relations quality upgrading" three parts of the video won warm applause.
The reception was also arranged with the theme "Celebration of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China" to attract guests to stay and watch.
Baidu launches first fleet of self-driving taxis
Yesterday, Baidu announced in Changsha that the pilot operation of Robotaxi, a fleet of self-driving taxis, had officially opened.
The first 45 "Red Flag EV" Robotaxi teams, developed jointly with FAW Red Banner, were tested in Changsha.
From now on, ordinary citizens of Changsha can log on to Apollo's website to apply for seed users, and have the opportunity to try the experience.
One experiential passenger said he sat in the back of the vehicle and clicked on the front screen in the passenger seat, which opened the vehicle's self-driving ride.

In order to ensure the safety of the passengers and the current policy and regulations, the pilot vehicle is equipped with a safety officer in the driving position to maximize the safety of the passengers.

In the course of driving, the vehicle can be changed according to the road conditions, and can also judge the driving condition of the surrounding vehicles, such as close proximity to the car to make automatic concessions.
Throughout the experience, the passenger area screen displays the road conditions of pedestrians, cars, and even some traditional blind areas in real time.
Even if the vehicle block, but also can see ahead traffic light change and wait time information, all the road conditions at a glance.
Unmanned has been heard on TV before and thought it was far away, but it feels amazing to find it in our lives today.
We expect it to truly enter the life of the common people in the future.
In June 2019, Apollo was awarded 45 manned test plates by the Changsha municipal government.

At present, the autonomous driving test open road in Changsha, passing through the Changsha Artificial Intelligence Technology City, Meixi Lake, Yanghu, Dawangshan, high-tech zones, etc., has a total length of 135 kilometers, the demonstration area of 70 square kilometers, is currently the longest road mileage in China, the largest, covering the most complex scene, the most advanced road coordination infrastructure intelligent driving demonstration areas.

It is expected that by the end of 2019, the Apollo Robotaxi fleet's trial operation in Changsha will cover approximately 50 km, with 135 km of road currently open in Changsha planned for the first half of 2020.
Women's volleyball player Lang Ping still has a grievance: It's hard to beat a strong team with so many mistakes
The ninth match of the 2019 FIVB Women's Volleyball World Cup began on Sunday afternoon with a 3 – 1 victory over the Netherlands in the final.
However, after the match, women's volleyball coach Lang Ping expressed dissatisfaction with the team's third-place performance.
