Lang Ping also commented on Chang Changning's performance, saying that she encountered some difficulties in the attack, more anxious, too want to kill the ball, the movement will be distorted.
Let her be patient. "All of us protect her."
China's development is an opportunity, not a threat or a challenge to the world.
(New China, 70 years) White Paper: China's development is an opportunity, not a threat or a challenge to the world.
The white paper says that China's development is an opportunity, not a threat or a challenge to the world.

"The white paper says that with China's overall national strength and international influence increasing rapidly, there are international fears that China will follow the path of" a strong nation with hegemony ".
This includes cognitive misinterpretation, deep-rooted bias, psychological imbalance due to power shifts, and deliberate distortion to defend one ’ s vested interests.
It is not only the dream of the Chinese people, but also the common dream of all the people in the world to achieve national prosperity and strength, national rejuvenation and people's happiness.
"China's development is an opportunity, not a threat or a challenge to the world.

The white paper says that China is the main stabilizer and power source of world economic growth, that China is the largest contributor to world economic growth, and that China's scientific and technological innovations inject new momentum into world economic growth.
At present, the world economic growth momentum is insufficient, and a sound Chinese economy is becoming increasingly important to the world.

China's economy is changing from rapid growth to high-quality development.New industrialization, informatization, urbanization and agricultural modernization have been accelerated, the economic structure has been further readjusted, industrial optimization has been continuously upgraded, and new economic growth points have emerged.

“According to the McKinsey Global Institute study, by 2040, China and the rest of the world could create between $22 trillion and $37 trillion in economic value, equivalent to 15-26% of the global economy, and the rest of the world and China could create significant economic value through closer cooperation. ”
The white paper stresses that China's economy has undergone structural changes and is deeply integrated with the world economy.
China, with a more stable economy, higher quality of growth and promising prospects for growth, is in the long run good for world economic development.

To regard China's economic development as a "threat" and "challenge" and try to push China out of global industrial chains, supply chains and value chains, and to "decouple" China from the world economy is both unfeasible and harmful.
The white paper says that opening up to the outside world in all directions will create more opportunities for countries to share the "China dividend.
China will unswervingly pursue a win-win strategy of opening up to the outside world with greater vigor and a higher level of opening-up.
"Openness should be two-way and mutually beneficial, not one-way and one side should benefit.
Only in both directions can there be long-term sustainability.
The white paper says that China is committed to continuously expanding imports, easing market access, improving the business environment and strengthening IPR protection.

Only when all parties meet one another can we create an environment of development that is open, tolerant, universally beneficial, balanced and win-win, and jointly make the development cake bigger and form a mutually beneficial and win-win community of interests.
The white paper says that China provides more public goods to the international community.

This includes promoting quality cooperation in building an "Belt and Road", setting up a platform for multilateral dialogue and cooperation, actively participating in international and regional affairs, and actively providing foreign aid.
"China's development benefits from the international community and it has always been able to give back to the international community, providing it with more and better public goods."

In a recent written interview with Xinhua News Agency, Andrei Slepniov, the managing director of Russia's export center, said Russia is ready to strengthen cooperation with China in the economic and trade fields to further optimize the export structure and promote diversification of Russian exports to China.

While forestry, machinery and chemicals account for a large proportion of Russia's exports to China, they are also very important in the export of agricultural products, including fats and fats, meat and dairy products, cereals, fish and seafood.
In recent years, the export of non-raw materials and non-energy products from Russia to China has also shown good and stable development.

While talking about Russia's efforts to optimize its export structure to China, Srepniov said Russia has set itself the task of expanding exports of high-tech products to meet the import needs of countries and regions around the world, including China.
Russia ’ s next step will be to improve financial and non-financial support for high-tech companies.
He said Russia is willing to export construction technology and high-tech building materials to China and develop cooperation with China in pharmaceutical and aviation manufacturing.
Russia and China also have great potential for cooperation in the field of urban environmental development.
He stressed that Russia's products in many areas were "qualitatively superior and competitively priced" compared with similar products in the West.

Speaking about the two countries' goal of achieving a bilateral trade volume of 200 billion U.S. dollars by 2024, Srepnikov said areas such as agriculture, machinery manufacturing, chemical industry and forestry will play an important role in achieving this goal.
The Russian side intends to diversify supply in these areas and to promote exports of further processed products.
He stressed that Russia intends to push its exporters into global value-added chains, including China.
Russian manufacturers in agriculture, metallurgy, oil and gas, and chemicals are well positioned to participate in this process.
Currently, the two countries need to continue to deepen cooperation between enterprises and "set up more Russian-Chinese joint ventures to jointly develop exports to third countries," he said.

The Russian export center, through the Russian Export Credit and Investment Insurance Administration and the Russian Export-Import Bank, is taking a variety of measures and services to support the export of Russian products to China, he said.

At the same time, the Russian export center will continue to deepen cooperation with relevant Chinese departments, promote easier access of Russian commodities to the Chinese market, and develop new categories of export products to China.
The global use of RMB payments by financial institutions has grown markedly.
The latest RMB tracking special edition of SWIFT, released on Thursday in London, shows a clear trend of an increase in financial institutions using RMB payments globally from July 2017 to July 2019.

At the SWIFT ’ s 2019 annual meeting in London, the agency ’ s “Renminbi Tracking Special Issue, ” entitled“ Perspectives on the renminbi from a London Perspective, ” showed that the number of financial institutions worldwide using renminbi payments rose by 11.31% from July 2017, to 2,214 from 1,989.
Of these, the number of financial institutions using renminbi payments in Africa and the Middle East increased the most, by 20.98%, from 143 in July 2017 to 173 in July 2019.
According to the report, the renminbi ’ s share of the global payments currency is 2.22% as of August 2019.
At the same time, London plays a leading role in the offshore exchange of the renminbi.
According to the report, in July 2019, London ’ s share of the world ’ s offshore foreign-exchange transactions in renminbi will be 33.79%, the highest in the world.
The report says London is firmly in first place in global foreign exchange trading.
In July 2019, London ’ s share of global foreign-exchange transactions was 40.14%, compared to 12.93% in the US and 7.67% in France.
Foreign Ministry Responds to Taiwan's Alleged "Diplomatic Breakthrough"
Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Geng Shuang, responding to a recent visit to the UN headquarters to attend a conference on religious issues, said the move was disgraceful and a joke.

Taiwanese media reported that staff of the Taipei office in New York had entered the United Nations headquarters to attend a meeting on religious issues held in the United States and called it a "diplomatic breakthrough".
The meeting you mentioned was a side event organized by the United States on the premises of the United Nations, not a United Nations meeting at all.

Geng Shuang said that the Taiwanese personnel infiltrated the United Nations in a surreptitious way, self-demeaning, and that the so-called "diplomatic breakthrough", this small action is disgraceful, laughing.

He noted that the United Nations side had reiterated on many occasions its commitment to dealing with the question of Taiwan in accordance with General Assembly resolution 2758 (XXVI), and that the vast majority of United Nations Member States also adhered to the one-China principle.
Hohhot to speed up the upgrading of the dairy industry structure - Xinhua News Agency

The government of Huhehaote, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, has learned that the city of Huhehaote has accelerated the upgrading of its dairy industry structure, with Yili and Mengniu among the top ten global dairy enterprises, and accelerated the implementation of projects such as the Yili Healthy Food Industry Park and Mengniu China Dairy Industry Park to create an upgraded version of China's Dairy Capital.

Demonstration of President ’ s Departure The authorities in Egypt have shown a strong crackdown
The Twitter-themed hashtag and social media are pushing hard for Egyptians to take to the streets today to peacefully demand the ouster of President el-Sissi.
But the authorities have indicated an intention to use force to suppress it.
Since el-Sissi, then head of the military, seized power in a military coup in 2013, expression of dissent has virtually disappeared in Egypt, and any form of protest is even more perilous.

Britain's Guardian newspaper says the Centre for Economic and Social Rights in Egypt, a Cairo NGO, says more than 1,900 people have been arrested since a rare weekend protest demanding el-Sissi's ouster.
Allegations of corruption surrounding el-Sissi and his family's profligate pursuit of vanity led to thousands of people taking to the streets on the 20th.
Egypt's Interior Ministry stood firm yesterday, saying it would 'stand firm' against any attempt to destabilize the country.

Cairo ’ s center is already heavily fortified, with anti-riot police, security agency vehicles, and plainclothes police on the streets surrounding Tahrir Square, the site of Egypt ’ s 2011 revolution.

Al-Jazeera reported that security forces detained a number of prominent academics and socialists on the 25th, including Naafis, a professor of political science at Cairo University and a prominent columnist.
"I have no doubt that the continuation of the absolute rule of Sessi will bring disaster," he tweeted on the 24th.
"It is in Egypt's interest for him to step down immediately," he said.
Before Naffa's arrest, Hosny, a former Egyptian military chief of staff, was detained.
Anan Nan was arrested last year after trying to contest the presidency with Sessi.
Davutoglu, chairman of the Constitutional Party, was also detained.
Analysts and politicians believe that, at a time of heightened economic hardship for the poor and the middle class, the purge reflects the instability and fragility of the government.
Ayman Nour, the opposition leader who once ran for the presidency, said: “The arrest underlines the regime ’ s disregard for the Egyptian people and its own fears. ”

"Because the economy has been screwed up by him and there is widespread political repression, Mr Sessi is trying to send a clear message to the key generals and politicians who are likely to replace him."
Nohl notes that, given the worsening socioeconomic situation, the government ’ s heavy-handed approach will only increase people ’ s anger.
Now that the fear barrier had been breached, he expected more people to take to the streets.

Ali, a Spanish-exiled businessman and actor who was once a construction contractor for the Egyptian military, began uploading a series of videos at the beginning of the month, blaming himself for benefiting from the government's corruption, setting off small demonstrations in different cities over the weekend.

Ali said his company, Amrak General, won a lucrative contract without going through the legal bidding process, stressing that corruption is rife among the military and Sessi's relatives, including First Lady Intissar Amer al-Sisi.
He was deeply remorseful that he had been involved.
Ali claims that his lavish palace and luxury hotel in Caithness stand in stark contrast to the abject poverty of today's Egyptians, who have not paid for it.

On Twitter, hashtags such as "Come up and you're not alone", "Sessi you're done", "Sessi got out" and "Next Friday" have attracted tens of thousands of tweets and retweets calling for people to take to the streets peacefully to demand that Sessi step down.
Hollywood Egyptian actor Almawk tweeted with nearly 7 million followers.
He tweeted in Arabic yesterday: "Sessi is doomed... He's done, and his supporters are now going to make a mistake."
Hong Kong Government to launch free special training scheme to help employees affected by the recent financial crisis

The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) announced on the 27th that it would launch a special free training scheme for employees affected by the recent financial situation. Eligible trainees will receive a monthly training allowance of up to HK $4,000 upon completion of their courses.
Many boutiques in Hong Kong's Tsim Sha Tsui Harbour have few customers.

As a result of the recent social strife in Hong Kong, there has been a significant drop in the number of visitors to Hong Kong. Apart from the travel industry, the hotel, catering and retail sectors have been affected.

The Secretary for Labour and Welfare of the HKSAR Government, Mr Lo Chi-kwong, and the Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development, Mr Yau Teng-wai, met the media on the commissioning of the Employees Retraining Board (ERB) to carry out a special training programme, as well as measures to support the travel industry.
Mr Lo said the challenges to Hong Kong's economy were urgent and should not wait for calm to set in.
Therefore, the HKSAR Government has launched a free training programme called "Special? Love Value Added".
Those who lost their jobs or were asked by their employers to take unpaid leave from 1 June will have the opportunity to join the scheme if they meet the requirements, it said.

The most important part of the course is the "vocational skills" training, covering 19 trades including travel, retail and catering. There will also be some new "innovation and technology" courses as well as cross-sector "general skills" courses.
The Chairman of the Employees Retraining Board, Mr Yu Pengchun, said that all courses were free of charge and the scheme was expected to support about 10,000 people in need.
A participant who has completed each full-time or part-time programme and has an attendance rate of 80% is entitled to a special allowance up to HK $4,000 per participant per month.
The training course will be offered by about 50 training organisations for two to three months from October 3 to March 31 next year.
In addition, the HKSAR Government has announced a series of measures to support the tourism industry to help it overcome its difficulties.
These measures include relaxing funding for the Tourist Industry Council, subsidising the renewal of registration of 6,000 guides for courses, and waiving annual fees for travel agents.
Exercise is exhausting, too?
A study of athletes showed that their brains also showed signs of fatigue after high-intensity exercise, the Russian Satellite Network reported.

The study, led by Mathias Percignon, a specialist at the Hospital of Pittier-Salpetril in France, shows an insignificant link between mental and physical labour: both require cognitive control of activity.
"You need to control the autonomous process that can force yourself to stop when you're in muscle and joint pain," explained Percignon.
The study was initiated by the French National Institute of Physical Education and Sport (INSEP).
The school specialist is responsible for guiding the athletes' preparations for the Olympics.
Some athletes have begun to suffer from overtraining syndrome, a condition in which they experience uncontrollable fatigue after high-load workouts, lack of recovery and a decline in performance.
INSEP asks whether part of the problem is neurofatigue, the kind that results from excessive mental effort.
The study was published in the journal Current Biology.
A special exhibition planned by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism and the Chinese Art Museum to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China has been unveiled.

Xu Beihong's "Benma", Qi Baishi's "Peace in a Thousand Years", Li Ke Yin's "Wanshan red all over the forest", Jin Shanyi's "Tajik Bride", Luo Neong's "Father" and Liu Wenxi's "Four Dynasties of the Sun" 480-odd exquisite works, collected from more than 20 major domestic art galleries, almost all of the classics since the founding of New China.

"Great Journeys and Majestic Paintings: An Exhibition Celebrating the 70th Anniversary of the Founding of the People's Republic of China" is a multi-dimensional exhibition of the spectacular progress and outstanding achievements of the 70 years of New China's founding, as well as the unremitting fighting and self-improvement of the Chinese people.
The exhibition consists of a preface and four chapters.
The exhibition features more than 480 works, including Chinese paintings, oil paintings, prints, sculptures, watercolor powder, New Year paintings and posters.
In addition, the Ministry of Culture and Tourism organized the implementation of "national thematic art creation" just completed more than 130 realistic theme new works for the first time.

In order to present the exhibition, the Chinese Museum of Art invoked all the exhibition spaces of the museum for the first time, except for the three floors of the hall, where the outdoor courtyard space was also created as a sculpture exhibition area, and through the exhibition design to form an exhibition pattern of internal and external correspondence.
It is understood the exhibition will run until November 2.
The Chinese Museum of Art was suspended from September 28 to October 1 in line with the unified arrangement of events in Beijing to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the founding of New China.

On September 27, World Tourism Day, the theme of which is "Tourism and work: building a better future for all", MGTO has organized a series of activities, including a contest to welcome lucky travelers and traditional trays to celebrate with residents and travelers.

On the same day, the World Tourism Day Celebration Dinner was held to promote exchanges with the tourism industry.The Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, Mr Tam Chun-wing, attended the event and shared the views of the Macau tourism industry.

Director of Macau Tourist Office (MGTO), Ms Ven Yee Hua, Deputy Director of Macau Tourist Office (MGTO), Mr Hui Yiu-ming, and other officials arrived at Macau International Airport on the same day to present souvenirs to the lucky visitors on World Tourism Day.
Mr. Wipoosiri and his family from Thailand have been the lucky visitors this year. He said they come to Macau about four to five times a year.
Macau tourism mascots, "McMuir" Machinists, are also on site to welcome visitors, and souvenirs are available at the Visitors' Enquiry Counter of MGTO throughout the day.

The traditional pallets competition was held in the afternoon on the same day. It was attended by close to 180 participants representing over 29 hotels and restaurants in Macau. This year marks the 20th anniversary of the establishment of the Macao Special Administrative Region. The participants posed for a group photo with the figure "20" in Da San Ba Square before their departure.
There were also participants wearing distinctive costumes to match the theme of the return.
The participants walked through the streets of Macau's historic center carrying trays of bottles of beer, bringing beer to the precincts of the terminal as quickly as possible.
Warren Obejas Cabada of Sands City Centre of Macau won the men's category. The women's category was won by Yip Siu Ching of Jia King Group and Cui Zhihong of Golden Dragon Hotel.
In the evening, MGTO invited hundreds of guests, including representatives of relevant departments, industry and media, to attend the World Tourism Day Celebration Dinner.

At the dinner, Mr Tam said that the Macau tourism industry was returning to 20 years of tourism development, but was faced with changing environmental factors. He encouraged the industry to think creatively, build on the successes already achieved, adjust its strategies and devise new tourism products and promotion models to expand the market, and encourage the industry to continue to support the growth and sustainability of Macau's tourism industry.

Under the theme of "Celebration of the 20th Anniversary of the Establishment of the Macao Special Administrative Region", Macau singers will perform the local original congratulatory song "Lotus to the Family", and six major tour companies will present a variety of performances on the theme of the return, showcasing Macau's diverse tourism and leisure elements and the multi-talented side of tourism practitioners.

Since 1980, the World Tourism Organization has designated September 27 as World Tourism Day in order to raise the awareness of the international community of the importance of tourism, especially its social, cultural, political and economic values.
Central banks launch 30 billion yuan inverse repo operation
Beijing, September 27 (Xinhua) -- The People's Bank of China (PBOC) conducted a 30 billion yuan reverse repurchase operation by means of an interest-rate tender.
As a result of the $10 billion purchase price increase, the Bank of the People's Republic of China (PBOC) was able to raise $10 billion.
According to the central bank ’ s announcement, 30 billion yuan of reverse repurchase operations were carried out that day for a period of 14 days, with a 2.7% target rate.
It is the seventh consecutive working day for the central bank to carry out a 14-day period of counter-repurchase operations.

The overnight rate was 1.313%, down 32.4 basis points from the previous day; the seven-day rate was 2.59%, up 1.3 basis points from the previous day; the 14-day rate was 2.95%, down 1.7 basis points from the previous day; and the one-year rate was 3.048%, flat from the previous day.
Let Chinese citizens "go out" more peace of mind
Wherever you go, the motherland is behind you.
On the 25th, the first foreign ministry consulate protection public welfare video online, the short film ends this sentence caused the majority of netizens to resonate.

Speaking to Xinhua, Choi Ai-min, director of the Foreign Ministry's Consular Department, said the clip is aimed at making the public feel the "diplomatic for the people" sentiment and temperature, so that Chinese citizens feel that wherever they are in the world, Chinese diplomats will help them, giving them help, strength and hope.
Overseas security is no small matter, a leaf of the total customs.

According to Mr Cui, in the past 70 years, the number of Chinese citizens "going out" has increased dramatically, from less than a million a year before reform and opening up to the current hundred million a year.

Statistics show that since the 18th Party Congress, we have organized more than 10 major operations to evacuate or transfer overseas Chinese citizens, and more than 40,000 Chinese citizens have been safely evacuated from dangerous and volatile areas.
Some 500,000 cases involving nearly 1 million Chinese citizens were handled and coordinated.
In times of danger, your country can take you home; a "go and leave" trip is no longer a dream.
By the end of August, China had concluded visa-free agreements with 14 countries, covering ordinary passport holders, according to Mr Cui.
In addition, a growing number of countries have unilaterally granted entry facilities such as visa-free or visa-free entry to Chinese citizens.

Forty-two countries and regions, such as Thailand and Egypt, have unilaterally granted visas to Chinese citizens with ordinary passports, while 15 countries, such as Indonesia, have unilaterally granted visa-free entry to Chinese citizens with ordinary passports.
In addition to the visa-free and landing arrangements, visa applications by Chinese citizens have become more convenient and easier.
By the end of August, China had concluded agreements or arrangements to simplify visa procedures with 41 countries.
In addition, the United States, the United States, Canada, Israel, and Argentina have entered into a 10-year mutual visa arrangement with each other for travel, business, and family visits.
Britain and Belgium have launched a one-stop visa service, while France, Italy and Singapore have reduced the processing time to 48, 36 and 24 hours respectively.
For business people who go abroad frequently, the APEC Business Travel Card with multiple entry and convenient customs clearance is a good choice.
According to Choi, holding the card is equivalent to being granted a visa for five years in 16 economies around the region, meaning a lot to business people, especially in private enterprises.
Currently, China has the highest number of active card holders of any APEC economy.

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs will actively negotiate bilateral visa reciprocity agreements, push more countries to adopt visa facilitation measures for Chinese citizens, turn more diplomatic achievements into measures to benefit the people and benefit the people, and constantly improve the 'gold content' of Chinese passports.
National Day is approaching.
Yesterday morning, Party secretary Cai Qi led a team to inspect the safety of production and the supply of festive market during the National Day.

He stressed the need to improve political standing, strengthen bottom-line thinking, do a solid and meticulous job to ensure the safe running of the city and market supply, welcome the 70th anniversary of the founding of New China, and let citizens enjoy a happy and peaceful holiday.

On October 26, 2018, the Fuzhou Central Branch of the People's Bank of China, together with the Fujian Provincial Taxation Bureau of the State Administration of Taxation and China UnionPay Co., Ltd. signed a memorandum of cooperation to create the first national platform for the tax payment of Fujian Province.
After nearly a year of construction, the platform has now been successfully put online.

Wang Dehui, head of the treasury department of Fuzhou Central Branch of the People's Bank of China, said that the platform adheres to the construction concepts of security, versatility, convenience, compliance and leadership, and connects the front end of the platform with the tax, government, bank, non-bank payment agencies and social service providers.

It is reported that the platform brings together a number of projects for the benefit of the people, among which the urban and rural residents' medical insurance payment check project has been formally put on the line.
The project has opened 14 channels offline, serving more than 30 million urban and rural residents in Fujian Province, covering 76% of the province ’ s resident population.

It is possible to pay health insurance fees by "cloud payment" and APP, WeChat, etc.; it is possible to pay health insurance fees by sweeping codes, swiping cards, swiping cards, etc., in all tax halls and rural PFS points in Fujian Province.

The deputy governor of Fuzhou Central Branch of the People ’ s Bank of China, Shi Dong, said that the successful launch of the platform, while ensuring the real-time interaction of the government ’ s direct revenue collection and data information, would provide the public with a safe and efficient, multi-channel, multi-mode, and convenient payment service.

At present, over 9,000 of the 16,000 inclusive financial service centers across the province have opened the function of checking and paying medical insurance premiums, enabling rural residents to safely check and pay their medical insurance premiums without leaving their villages, and enabling the public to have a growing sense of "access" and "happiness".

According to statistics, the number of users of the platform's medical insurance fee checking and payment scheme for urban and rural residents has reached 840,000 since the first 20 days of operation on a trial basis.

In addition, the State Administration of Taxation Fujian Province Tax Bureau Deputy Director Lin Guoqiao at the event revealed that the platform was the first in the country to use blockchain electronic payment certificate technology.
Starting from next month, the payer can also download the stamped electronic payment certificate directly from his mobile phone after the payment.
The Fujian tax information network based on blockchain technology is being established, and the "highway" of private tax payment will be further widened.

"Jiejiao has been" two major ultra high-voltage projects
On the 26th day, from the east to the south of Anhui ± 1100 kV HVDC project, the Su Tong 1000 kV AC UHV GIL Integrated Pipeline Project was put into operation.
Both of these two projects occupy the height of the respective fields of the current world power transmission technology.
According to Guo Zhi, chief economist of the National Energy Bureau, the project is the world's largest transmission capacity and furthest distance.
It is of great significance to promote the development of Xinjiang energy base and to guarantee the power supply in eastern China.
GIL, gas insulated metal enclosed transmission line.
The Su Tong Pipe Corridor Project has created the record of the highest voltage level and the highest transmission capacity in the world of the GIL project.
According to the State Grid Corporation, the distance of transmission of electricity from the Quasi-East to the Southern Anhui Project is up to 3,324 kilometers.

With conventional technology, more than 15% of the electricity will be lost in transit, and the project has been developed to significantly increase the economic transmission distance to more than 3000 km.

After launching the project from the east to the south of Anhui, 100 million degree-level electricity can be delivered every 8 hours and 20 minutes, which can help solve the problem of elimination of new energy sources in Xinjiang.
According to the full-load estimate, this line alone will deliver between 60 and 85 billion kWh of electricity per year, enough to supply more than half of Shanghai's electricity.
The Su Tong GIL Integrated Tube Corridor Project is a control project of the UHV AC loop network crossing the Yangtze River.

To cross the Yangtze River on a conventional overhead line, two giant towers of up to 450 meters have to be erected along the Yangtze River, and an artificial island the size of four football fields has to be built for each tower.

In response, the State Grid has made bold innovations in the development of the compact, ultra-high voltage AC GIL transmission technology, using tunnels to cross the river from under the water, avoiding the impact on the Golden Channel.
Two projects have promoted our country electrician equipments manufacturing ability to achieve new leaps.
Currently, the State Grid has completed a total of "10 interchange 11" ultra-high voltage projects, and "4 interchange 3" is under construction.
Foreign Exchange Bureau: The Stability of China's Foreign Debt Structure Sustained Optimized
"Overall, the structure of our country's foreign debt has been continuously optimized and the stability of our foreign debt has been enhanced."

According to Wang Chunying, press spokesperson and chief economist of the State Administration of Foreign Exchange (SAFE), the main indicators of China's foreign debt are all within the internationally recognized security line.
Wang Chunying was the foreign exchange bureau in the end of June 2019 data, answered the reporter's question to make the above statement.

According to the data, China ’ s full-diameter (including domestic and foreign currency) foreign debt balance stood at US $19.98 billion at the end of June 2019, up by US $26.3 billion or 1.3% from the end of March 2019, mainly due to the increase in the balance of debt securities.

In the second quarter of 2019, more than 70% of the increase in China's full-bore foreign debt was driven by the purchase of domestic RMB bonds by non-residents, who were mainly medium- and long-term investors such as the central bank.

At the end of June 2019, the share of medium and long-term foreign debt rose by 3 percentage points compared to the end of March 2019, and the share of foreign debt in local currency rose by 1 percentage point compared to the end of March 2019.

According to Wang Chunying, with China ’ s domestic RMB bonds being included in the Bloomberg Barclays Global Aggregate Index in April 2019, international investors ’ recognition of China ’ s bond market has been further enhanced, and China ’ s domestic RMB bonds have continued to be held.
"China's balance of payments to maintain the overall balance, the foreign debt risk can be controlled."

Correspondent 27 from the Yunnan Academy of Agricultural Sciences has learned that, at present, Yunnan grassland nocturnal moth has been effective prevention and control, did not cause widespread outbreaks of disaster, prevention and control work has achieved phase results.

In January of this year, the river city of Pu'er, Yunnan Province, first discovered the migration of grass nocturnal moth from outside the country, later confirmed in 129 counties in Yunnan Province, grassland nocturnal moth also gradually spread from Yunnan to mainland China, posing a direct threat to China's grain production.

It is a multi-food long-distance migratory important agricultural pest native to tropical and subtropical America. It is one of the most important migratory pests of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO).
The pest harms more than 80 kinds of crops, such as corn, sugar cane and sorghum.
It is very difficult to control and there are no registered pesticides in China.

Since the invasion of Yunnan Province, the Yunnan Academy of Agricultural Sciences has selected Chen Aidong to lead the provincial innovation team of the Yunnan Academy of Agricultural Sciences in the prevention and control of transboundary agricultural pests.

Chen Aitong's team has preliminarily grasped the population characteristics, natural enemy insect resources, overseas insect source characteristics, population migration trajectory, drug toxicity and field control effects of the species.

They have been active in the research and application of green prevention and control technologies.Through the implementation of new green prevention and control techniques, such as population monitoring, insect trapping, scientific use of drugs and agronomic measures, the results of prevention and control in the demonstration areas have reached more than 90%.
At present, the nocturnal moth of Yunnan grassland has been effectively controlled, and no widespread outbreaks have occurred.
The next step, the Yunnan Academy of Agricultural Sciences will focus on the ecological mechanism of population invasion, break through biological prevention and control technology system.

At the same time, active efforts will be made to promote cross-border international cooperation and to establish joint key laboratories and joint monitoring networks and demonstration zones abroad, so as to enhance the all-round monitoring and early warning capabilities of the Yunnan grassland moth.

White Paper: China Takes a Road of Development in Condition
Beijing, September 27 (Xinhua) -- The Information Office of the State Council of China released a white paper entitled "China and the World in the New Age" on Wednesday.

"Over the past 70 years, the Chinese people have made painstaking efforts to explore and forge ahead, successfully blazing the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and achieving development that has attracted worldwide attention," the white paper says.
The white paper says that China's development depends on its self-reliance and hard work.

The development of China is based on the spirit of "800 million shirts for a Boeing", with generations of continuous drive, hard work and sweat on the part of others which are hard to imagine; on the spirit of "being able to shoulder the burden on our own shoulders", whether in prosperity or in adversity, not exporting problems, not passing the buck to others for contradiction, not buying and selling by force, and robbing others for development; and on the spirit of "crossing the river by feel the stone", not taking the old road of imperialism and colonialism and not copying the model of development of Western countries, but combining it with China's reality, taking stock of lessons learned, learning from human civilization, and daring to try and get out of one's own way.

"The white paper says that China has developed in its interaction with the world, that China's development has injected positive energy into world peace and development, and that China's road accords with China's national conditions and meets the requirements of the times.
China takes concrete actions to safeguard world peace.
For 70 years, China has not initiated any war or conflict, or encroached on an inch of other countries' territory.

"The white paper says that in the past 70 years, China's development has achieved great success, and the fundamental reason is to find the correct path of development of socialism with Chinese characteristics and to follow it unswervingly.

This is the way to establish a country in accordance with its national conditions, put the interests of the people first, carry out reform and innovation, pursue common development in the process of opening up and govern the country by law in an all-round way.
Without centralized and strong leadership, China will disintegrate and disintegrate, bringing disaster to the world.
'Over the past 70 years, China has overcome all risks and challenges, and created one China miracle after another that has attracted worldwide attention, 'the white paper says.

Since the 18th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, in particular, China has made historic achievements in its development and undergone historic transformation.The Chinese nation has ushered in a great leap from rising to prosperity to strength, closer than at any time in its history to the great goal of national rejuvenation.
With the advance of the times, China's development path will increasingly show bright prospects for development.
Representatives of 45 countries and regions jointly issued the Declaration of the World Trade in Textiles.
At the second World Fabric Congress in 2019, representatives of 45 countries and regions of the textile industry jointly issued the World Fabric Declaration.

The declaration points out that, facing the future, the countries concerned adhere to the principle of opening up and coordination, science and technology-driven development and fashion change, and will work together to promote the development of high quality in the world textile industry.

The World Congress of cloth traders gathered some 1,200 textile industry representatives from 45 countries and regions to explore a win-win situation for sustainable development and cooperation in the global textile industry, focusing on the trend of the textile industry in the global economic structure.
Sun Ruizhe, president of the China Textile Industry Federation, said that the current global pattern of industrial division of labour, trade and innovation is undergoing profound readjustment.

Standing at the "crossroads" of the global textile transformation and upgrading, Sun Ruizhe said, "Sustainable development and common prosperity of the industry will require the active participation of the global textile people, the sharing of their strengths and interests."

At the conference, representatives of 45 countries and regions in the textile industry jointly issued the "Declaration of the World Textile Trader," jointly elaborated the global textile industry development goals and vision.

The Declaration states that, facing the future, the countries concerned will persevere in opening up and coordinating with each other and continuously promote the interconnection between industry and the market so as to jointly raise the level of industrial chain development; will adhere to the drive of science and technology, continuously strengthen basic research, applied research and technological transformation, and jointly enhance the basic industrial capabilities; and will take the cohesive force of fashion change to bring into full play the role of textile and clothing as a cultural carrier and civilized bridge so as to jointly promote the cultural values of the industry.

Lureno Bartholomei, president of the Brazilian Association of Fashion Designers, said in an interview that the publication of the Declaration of the World ’ s Clothing Traders will help all countries to improve the development level of their textile industry chains and achieve the sustainable development of the textile industry.

Loureno Bartholomei, for example, points to more than 130 high-end local ready-to-wear brands of the Brazilian Fashion Designers' Association, which is dedicated to designing stylish, high-end clothing products, and to the variety of fine fabrics available in Corbridge.

As the site of the World Congress of Fabrics, Ke Qiao has the largest textile market in the world, and is gradually building a new pattern of upgrading and opening to the outside world with its unique textile industry chain.

Mr Shen Zhijiang, the party secretary, said Mr Kao would take the opportunity of the meeting to push the textile industry forward in a more open, inclusive, beneficial, balanced and win-win direction.

The completion of Zhou Dafu, the tallest building in northern China, created more than 100 national patents

The completion ceremony of Tianjin Chou Dafu Financial Center, the tallest building in the north of China, was held in Tianjin Binhai New Area on Sunday afternoon, marking the success of the collaborative management platform of the high-precision BIM model, an architectural information model that has been awarded the Global Excellence Award by the Tianjin Chou Dafu Financial Center Project Department of China Construction Bureau.

Tianjin Chow Tai Fook Financial Centre is located in Tianjin Economic and Technological Development Zone, with a total construction area of 390,000 square meters, four floors underground, 100 floors above the ground level, a building height of 530 meters, including Grade A offices, luxury apartments, ultra five-star hotels.

The total amount of steel used in the project is over 70,000 tons, and the height of the high-altitude group is about 376,000 meters of weld seams. It is equivalent to 42.5 Mount Everest heights. It can revolve around the earth 40 times with welding wire.
The complexity and processing difficulty of the steel structure of Tianjin Zhoudaofu Project are unprecedented.

According to industry sources, Tianjin Chow Tai Fook Financial Centre, in the country has been built or under construction in the skyscraper project, the first all-directional implementation of the building information model (BIM) management.

Creatively put forward and successfully implemented the "Three BIM Applications" model with full staff participation, full professional application and full process implementation, and developed the collaborative management platform based on the high-precision BIM model.

The director said that during the construction of Chow Tai Fook, the project department first carried out BIM construction in the virtual world and carried out scientific and accurate verification before carrying out physical construction, thereby eliminating the problem of pre-existing construction engineering that might produce demolition and rework.

In 2017, the BIM innovation of the Chow Tai Fook Financial Center Project was awarded the first prize of the Construction Group of the Global Award of Excellence in Engineering Industry by the Global Master Hub and the Global Award of Excellence in Engineering Industry in 2017.
During the construction of the project, more than 130 national patents were created.

The 86th Sino-Myanmar Mekong River joint patrol law enforcement completed.

Press Office of the Yunnan Provincial Public Security Bureau said that at 15: 30, three Chinese law enforcement boats and two Laotian law enforcement boats participated in the 86th joint patrol, marking the successful conclusion of the joint patrol.
The operation was launched in Guanjie on the 24th, and lasted four days and three nights.
During the operation, the formations carried out joint patrols and anti-drug publicity activities in the Golden Triangle, the Lao Pancango and the Meng Mo key waters.

In addition, China sent delegations of police hands-on instructors to the 122nd and 133rd border guard companies of the Lao People's Army to conduct exchanges of police hands-on skills, effectively enhancing the joint emergency response capabilities of the law enforcement officers of the two sides.

The four countries also held an exchange conference on law enforcement cooperation in Chiang Seng, Thailand, at which they briefed each other on recent developments in border management, combating drug crimes and the security situation in the Mekong River basin, reached consensus on strengthening information exchange, research and law enforcement cooperation, and held cultural and sports exchanges among the four countries, including football, cane ball, iron ball and tug of war competitions, effectively enhancing mutual understanding among law enforcement members and friendship in law enforcement cooperation among the four countries.

After the end of the operation, the two sides will continue to carry out a 10-day joint patrol and sub-patrol mission to improve the Mekong River and maintain the security and stability of the Mekong River basin.

Thailand's side commander said that since the launch of the Mekong joint patrol law enforcement, China, Lao Myanmar and Thailand have made close exchanges, deepened practical cooperation and achieved fruitful results in law enforcement security cooperation, cultural exchanges and other fields.

We hope that the four-party law enforcement cooperation will deepen and expand, and work hard to open up a new situation of four-country law enforcement cooperation, so as to make new contribution to maintaining the security and stability of the Mekong River basin.
Iranian Defense Minister Amir Khatami said on Tuesday that he was opposed to any agreement with the West on Iran's missile program.
Khatami was quoted by the Islamic Republic News Agency as saying that any agreement with the United States on Iran's "missile force" would damage Iraq's capabilities.
According to Khatami, Iran ’ s leaders support improved missile programs.

Iran ’ s nuclear deal with Iran ’ s six countries was agreed in 2015, and the US withdrew from the deal last May, reinstating and tightening sanctions on Iran, seeking to use extreme pressure to force Iran to renegotiate the Iran nuclear deal with the US in order to limit Iran ’ s weapons programs and regional activities.
Some Western leaders used the occasion of the UN General Assembly to mediate tensions between the US and Iran.
British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, German Chancellor Angela Merkel, and French President Emmanuel Macron met on the sidelines of the General Assembly.

Iranian President Hassan Rouhani told reporters Thursday that Iran is willing to discuss "minor changes, additions or amendments" to the Iran nuclear deal, provided U.S. sanctions are lifted.
2019 Tokyo International Film Festival

"Under the White Cloud," the only Chinese-language film to be shortlisted for the main competition section of the 32nd Tokyo International Film Festival, which opened on Oct. 28, will compete with 13 other shortlisted films for the Golden Unicorn Award, the top prize at the Tokyo International Film Festival.

"Under the White Cloud" is the fifth film directed by Professor Wang Rui of "TaoLi Manchu World", about a pair of ordinary Mongolian herdsmen and wife, the different life pursuit of a certain difficult life, Mongol actors Jizhimitu, Tanah.
"Under the White Cloud" has two world premieres at the festival, on October 31 and November 3.

The 32nd Tokyo International Film Festival is scheduled to be held from Oct. 28 to Nov. 5 at the Roppongi and Hibiya venues in Tokyo.In the afternoon of September 26, the organizing committee of the festival held a press conference and formally announced the main competition unit for the Golden Unicorn Award, the "Future of Asia" unit, "Special Guests", the Japanese Cinema Splash, "Focus of the World" and other units, as well as the list of films.
The person in charge of the competition film selections introduces the Chinese entry "Under the White Cloud".
Zhang Ziyi is chairman of the international jury of the main competition section of the festival.
'Asian Future 'unit has three Chinese-language films

In the Tokyo International Film Festival series, its importance is second only to that of the main competition film, "Asia's Future", although there are only eight shortlisted films, six fewer than the main competition, and three Chinese-language films from mainland China and Hong Kong.
The two Hong Kong films are The Revenge of the Baby, directed by Lu Yishen, The Man from the Road, directed by Huang Qingxun and starring Yang Qianmian, and The Night Knight, directed by Yau Ying.

In addition, the Sino-Japanese cooperative action adventure film "Ice Rush", directed by Yu Fei and starring Yakushiguchi, Zhang Jingchu and Lin Baohong, will also be shown at the festival as a "special treat".
The festival spokesperson, "The Goddess" Gangase Alice, was absent from the press conference to deliver a video message.
Famous director Yoshinori Yamada.

At the press conference, the President of the Tokyo International Film Festival Ando Yukang, the Director of the Film Festival Kusamatsu Takamatsu, and the heads of the unit responsible for the selection of films, speaking on the occasion, introduced the objectives of the festival and the films shown.

As a special guest of the press conference, the opening film — the 50th installment of the Tora-san series, Tora-san's Story: Welcome Back — features Yoshida Yamada as the director, two Japanese film directors who have been shortlisted for the main competition unit: Shin Tezuka ("Balopola"), Fushiori Fujimi ("The Story of the Comedy Wife"), and Ikushi Nakajima, a well-known screenwriter and screenwriter, who also appears at the press conference, talking about his feelings about participating in the Tokyo Film Festival.

The International Jury of the Main Competition Unit consisted of five judges, chaired by China's Zhang Ziyi, and four others: American producer Bill Gerber, French actor and producer Julie Gaye, Danish director Michael Knoll, and Japanese director Ryuichi Hiroki.

Separately, TIFFCOM, which is being held in conjunction with the Tokyo International Film Festival, will hold a record 401 group exhibitors this year, especially from China, at the Ikebukuro Sunjō Convention and Exhibition Center from Oct. 22-24, up 6.4 times from last year's 14.

For this reason, TIFFCOM has designated October 22 as CHINA DAY ("China Day"), with a number of lectures and seminars, and invited Japanese director Hiroyuki Ishii to participate in related activities.

On September 26, Baidu announced the launch of the unmanned "Level 4" fully self-driving taxi fleet Robotaxi's trial operation on specific highways in Changsha, Hunan Province.

New Regulation: Qualified for Rural Land Management Rights with Social Capital
Qualified persons are required to acquire rural land management rights with social capital
Measures for the Management of the Transfer of Rural Land Management Rights

Yesterday, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs issued a notice on the public consultation on the Measures for the Administration of the Transfer of Rural Land Management Rights (Revised Draft Solicitation Draft) (hereinafter referred to as the Opinions Draft), increasing the supervision and risk prevention for industrial and commercial enterprises and other social capital transfer to obtain the right to land management.
The draft Opinions are now open to the public for comments.

According to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, in order to implement the newly amended Law on Rural Land Contracting, further consolidate and improve the rural basic management system, deepen the reform of the rural land system and implement the system of "three rights separation", the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs revised the Measures for the Administration of the Transfer of the Right to Contract and Operate Rural Land, forming the "Opinions".
Beijing Youth Daily reporters have learned that for the first time, the publication of "opinion draft" has a number of important changes.

The newly amended Law on Rural Land Contracting clarifies the scope of land transfer and implements the concept of "separation of the three rights", establishing the "right to contract and manage the land" and the "right to operate the land" in a special section, making a clear distinction between the transfer, swap and transfer (lease, subcontract, equity or other means) of land management rights.

In the opinion draft, in order to implement the concept of "three rights separation" and effectively respond to the main tenets of the Law on the Amendment of the Law on Rural Land Contracting, and in view of the differences in the parties, procedures and supervision of the transfer of land management rights and the interchange of land management rights, the revised draft defines the scope of the transfer, focuses on the transfer of land management rights, the transfer of ownership, including rent, ownership, etc., the name of the regulation "rural land contract management rights transfer management methods" was revised to "rural land management rights transfer management methods".
There will be separate management measures for the transfer and exchange of land contract rights.
The Opinions notes that, in the context of the "three rights separation", farmers are only entitled to a certain period of land management.

Theoretically, even if a bankruptcy occurs, farmers are only at risk of losing their right to operate for a certain period of time, so it is not legally necessary for the contract to be returned to the original contractor, and there is a conflict with the Bankruptcy Law.
In view of the problem of preventing farmers from losing their land, preference shares, first rent, then stock, repurchase, etc.
Considering that preferred shares in the company law has a more mature theory of discussion, we suggest that it is as a prevention of the risk of land loss.
